      • neighbors

        java.util.Collection<? extends UTNode<L,T>> neighbors()
        Description copied from interface: Node
        The neighbors of this node. Each node occurs once, even if there are multiple links. Will include the node itself if there are multiple links.

      • links

        java.util.Collection<? extends UTLink<L,T>> links(Node<L> other)
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Returns all links between this node and the given other node. For directed graphs, this will return links in both directions.
        Specified by:

      • label

        L label()

        Connects this node to another node.

        The only prescription is that if this method succeeds, the other node shows up in this nodes' neighbours()

        The particulars of the connection are not prescribed by this interface, nor does this interface prescribe what should happen when the connection already exists.

        Specified by:
        label in interface Node<L>
        Parameters:
        other -

      • graph

        UTGraph<L,T> graph()
        Returns the graph object to which these nodes belong. Nodes always belong to a single graph and cannot be exchanged between them.
        Specified by:
        graph in interface Node<L>
        Specified by:
        graph in interface TNode<L,T>

      • connect

        UTLink<L,T> connect(Node<L> to)
        Description copied from interface: Node

        Connects this node to another node.

        The only prescription is that if this method succeeds, the other node shows up in this nodes' neighbours()

        The particulars of the connection are not prescribed by this interface, nor does this interface prescribe what should happen when the connection already exists.

        Specified by:
        connect in interface Node<L>
        Specified by:
        connect in interface TNode<L,T>

      • connect

        UTLink<L,T> connect(TNode<L,T> other,
                  T tag)
        Description copied from interface: TNode

        Connects this node to another node.

        The only prescription is that if this method succeeds, the other nod shows up in this nodes' neighbours()

        The particulars of the connection are not prescribed by this interface, nor does this interface prescribe what should happen when the connection already exists.

        Specified by:
        connect in interface TNode<L,T>
